f8ea4ee2-f09c-47dd-8998-9a6f5be5ac1a: A hagbound must select one of the following patrons: Deception, Winter, Shadow, Strength.
2a1affb8-2d5d-4d77-a2e7-be5a45c06584: A hagbound's hands grow into a pair of hideous claws that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Medium{/g} hagbound (1d3 for a Small creature).
56f0de07-bc13-4ec8-bbb2-b199e704e072: A hex channeler is a witch who devotes herself to either life — healing the wounded and destroying the undead — or death, slaying the living and aiding undead.
214157fc-63e9-4a0f-b1de-586656ce1356: A witch can cackle madly as a {g|Encyclopedia:Move_Action}move action{/g}. Any creature that is within 30 feet that is under the effects of an evil eye hex, fortune hex, protective luck, or misfortune hex caused by the witch has the duration of that hex extended by 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}.
324920fb-9eb3-4fcc-9c9c-54472871820e:
A witch can cause a creature within 30 feet to fall into a deep, magical sleep, as per the {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g} {g|SpellsSleep}sleep{/g}. The creature receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to negate the effect. If the save fails, the creature falls asleep for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level.
This hex can affect a creature of any {g|Encyclopedia:Hit_Dice}HD{/g}. This hex ends immediately if the creature takes {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
52fc1be2-9e3c-4e01-8e6d-d7f108f846f5: A witch of the veil gains {g|Encyclopedia:Stealth}Stealth{/g} and {g|Encyclopedia:Trickery}Trickery{/g} as class {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
2dd77d5e-4113-4965-b181-43d56687e5ba: Any potion that the cauldron witch drinks functions at twice its normal duration, as if affected by the {g|FeatureExtendSpell}Extend Spell{/g} metamagic {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g}.
e1a4e7e9-2136-4b22-94bd-cc89c23b7d87: At 10th level, the hagbound becomes exceptionally skilled at cursing others. She can cast {g|SpellsBestowCurse}bestow curse{/g} at will, but its duration becomes 24 hours. Once a creature has been affected by this ability, it is immune to the witch's vile curse ability for 24 hours.
9597b3a6-faf0-4e67-a751-bd7c03f7affe:
At 12th level, a hag of Gyronna forms a pact with a special companion— a night hag. The power of this night hag grows along with that of the hag of Gyronna.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 12th level, her night hag's level is 12. The night hag has the following {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsDeepSlumber}Deep Slumber{/g}, {g|SpellsInvisibility}Invisibility{/g}, {g|SpellsRayOfEnfeeblement}Ray of Enfeeblement{/g}, {g|SpellsMagicMissile}Magic Missile{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 13th level, her night hag reaches 13th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsBlindness}Blindness{/g}, {g|SpellsScare}Scare{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 14th level, her night hag reaches 14th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsHideousLaughter}Hideous Laughter{/g}, {g|SpellsHaste}Haste{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 15th level, her night hag reaches 16th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsDispelMagic}Dispel Magic{/g}, {g|SpellsVampiricTouch}Vampiric Touch{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 16th level, her night hag reaches 18th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsSlow}Slow{/g}, {g|SpellsContagion}Contagion{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 17th level, her night hag reaches 19th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsCrushingDespair}Crushing Despair{/g}, {g|SpellsFear}Fear{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 18th level, her night hag reaches 20th level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsPhantasmalKiller}Phantasmal Killer{/g}, {g|SpellsUnholyBlight}Unholy Blight{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 19th level, her night hag reaches 21st level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsEnervation}Enervation{/g}, {g|SpellsConfusion}Confusion{/g}.
When the hag of Gyronna reaches 20th level, her night hag reaches 23rd level and gains the following spells, which she can cast at will: {g|SpellsBalefulPolymorph}Baleful Polymorph{/g}, {g|SpellsConeOfCold}Cone of Cold{/g}.
9ebad2a4-4281-41f4-8520-5aefb55bbcd2:
At 1st level, a cauldron witch gains the ability to make an arcane mixture — a special substance that enhances her allies' abilities. Each arcane mixture gives a +2 alchemical {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to one of the abilities for a number of minutes equal to her witch level. She can use this ability a number of times equal to 3 plus her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier.
At 11th level, the bonus increases to +4.
870a7d8e-0e87-4e1a-adda-5884ab2192ac: At 1st level, a ley line guardian is adept at channeling energy from ley lines to enhance her own {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}. As a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}, she can increase her effective {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g} for the next spell she casts in that {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g}–1 levels. After performing a conduit surge, the ley line guardian must succeed at a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} ({g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} = 10 + level of spell cast + number of additional caster levels granted) or become {g|ConditionStaggered}staggered{/g} for a number of minutes equal to the level of the spell cast. At 8th level, the caster level increase becomes 1d4. She can use this ability a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier.
50e7fee7-f2b1-47db-b105-85aea77f3ab8:
At 1st level, a witch forms a close bond with a familiar, a creature that teaches her magic and helps to guide her along her path. Familiars also aid a witch by granting her {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill{/g} bonuses, additional {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, and help with some types of magic.
A witch must commune with her familiar each day to prepare her spells. Familiars store all of the spells that a witch knows, and a witch cannot prepare a spell that is not stored by her familiar. A witch's familiar begins play storing all of the 0-level witch spells plus three 1st level spells of the witch's choice. The witch also selects a number of additional 1st-level spells equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier to store in her familiar. At each new witch level, she adds two new spells of any spell level or levels that she can cast (based on her new witch level) to her familiar. A witch can also add additional spells to her familiar through a special ritual.
20d5396b-55be-4ffa-a3b0-48d8c4857b60:
At 1st level, an elemental witch selects one type of energy. She gains the ability to use this energy to create a ray of destruction, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Damage}energy damage{/g} plus an additional 1d6 {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} for every 3 witch levels as a ranged {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attack{/g}.
At 11th level, she selects one more energy type.
c74b996e-86ce-4035-8a99-00911efda428: At 1st level, any potion that the cauldron witch drinks works as if it was made by a caster of the witch's level.
fab22c51-597a-4775-85b1-ef9543a96d01:
At 1st level, when a witch gains her familiar, she must also select a patron. This patron is a vague and mysterious force, granting the witch power for reasons that she might not entirely understand. While these forces need not be named, they typically hold influence over one of the following forces.
At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch's patron adds new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to a witch's list of spells known. These spells are also automatically added to the list of spells stored by the familiar. The spells gained depend upon the patron chosen.
9e9e5e84-6ee2-40d1-aa5b-9dd7d2134294: At 20th level, the hagbound transforms into a true hag, purging all goodness and light from her in exchange for dark power. Her type changes to monstrous humanoid; she gains immunity to charm and fear effects. She also gains {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Resistance}spell resistance{/g} 31.
0dc23da5-7f87-42c7-abcd-7f1618cddb97:
At 2nd level, a hag of Gyronna gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Persuasion}Persuasion checks{/g}. In addition, the {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}save{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DCs{/g} of her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} with the fear {g|Encyclopedia:Spell_Descriptor}descriptor{/g} increases by 2.
This ability replaces the witch's 2nd-level hex.
b588c834-a304-426f-a840-8d25d64c055b:
At 2nd level, a hex channeler can call upon her patron to release a wave of energy from herself. A {g|Encyclopedia:Alignment}good{/g} witch channels positive energy (like a good cleric), and an evil witch channels negative energy (like an evil cleric). A witch who is neither good nor evil must choose whether she channels positive or negative energy; once this choice is made, it cannot be reversed.
Channeling energy causes a burst that affects all creatures of one type (either undead or living) in a 30-foot radius centered on the witch. The witch can channel energy a number of times per day equal to 3 + her {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier (minimum 1). The hex channeler uses her witch level as her cleric level for all other effects dependent upon channel energy (except increasing the amount of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}healed{/g} or dealt). The hex channeler can choose whether or not to include herself or her familiar in this effect.
This burst heals or deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g} points of damage. Every time the hex channeler is able to learn a new hex (including major or grand hexes), she can instead increase her channel energy amount by 1d6.
9d7cea49-587f-46f9-8c31-4f003df29322:
At 2nd level, a witch of the veil gains the ability to become invisible for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to her {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} as a {g|Encyclopedia:Swift_Action}swift action{/g}.
At 8th level, she also can teleport 30 feet and then become invisible, as per the {g|SpellsInvisibility}invisibility{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}.
At 16th level, she gains the benefits of the {g|SpellsGreaterInvisibility}greater invisibility{/g} spell instead.
8864020f-b8ac-4dba-b3a2-41a64dbfddf7: At 2nd level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch's patron adds new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} to a witch's list of spells known. These spells are also automatically added to the list of spells stored by the familiar. The spells gained depend upon the patron chosen. Each patron is listed by its theme. The witch might never know its actual name.
ae6c907c-86a5-46a7-8dfa-de7ea3458613: At 2nd level, warty growths and knobby muscles twist the hagbound's body. She gains a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Size}size{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to her {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} score. This bonus increases by 2 at 8th level and 14th level, to a maximum of +6.
0a8f31ba-104b-4728-a565-10ef335b178d: At 8th level, once per day after a hag of Gyronna has successfully affected a creature with a mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}, or hex, she also affects that creature with a {g|SpellsGreaterDispelMagicTarget}targeted greater dispel magic{/g} effect. At 14th and 20th levels, a hag of Gyronna can use this ability an additional time per day.
3a790a0c-3f17-45a7-954a-32b7414668df: Diseases, inhaled poisons, and noxious gaseous effects (such as {g|SpellsStinkingCloud}stinking cloud{/g}) are negated in a 10-foot aura around the witch for a number of minutes equal to her level. This duration does not need to be consecutive, but it must be spent in 1-minute increments. Effects caused by {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} whose level is more than half the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} are unaffected.
02af8cde-d80d-46e6-9627-41290325b986: Each witch chooses a patron among the arcane entities, such as elements, death, or fate. Patron determines a witch's specialization and gives them access to new {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}.
d726d1d1-ff7a-4f5a-82f4-9e3b1424f74b: Hexes are {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}special abilities{/g} available to witches and shamans. They are very versatile and can help you finely tune the character for their chosen role in the party. Some of the hexes duplicate the most powerful abilities of other classes.
93b19071-d553-4e9d-9cbb-add0272ce599: Instead of choosing a patron, a hag of Gyronna forms a pact with a night hag. This hag grants the witch a familiar and bonus {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} the same way the patron feature does.
48caa1c5-8ae5-4dcc-ae27-2e7788d44721: Instead of getting a new hex, you can increase the amount of energy channeled by your hex channeler's channel energy ability by {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d6{/g}.
438c7b4d-65e2-4ab2-b8b5-1a23927cca4e: Instead of preparing her {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}, a ley line guardian draws the power casting spells directly from ley lines. A ley line guardian is a spontaneous spellcaster. She knows the same number of spells and receives the same number of spell slots per day as a sorcerer of her witch level. Bonus spells granted by a ley line guardian's patron are added to the ley line guardian's total spells known at the appropriate levels.
1ceaa7bc-5365-4112-b4cb-0b7d49c2e4b1: Once per day the witch can, as a {g|Encyclopedia:Full_Round_Action}full-round action{/g}, touch a dead creature and bring it back to life. This functions as {g|SpellsResurrection}resurrection{/g}, but it does not require a material component.
f176d929-1e1a-4ebc-a04f-abebb881901e: Secrets, mysteries, and shrouds are the ever-changing backbone of the witch of the veil. She always strives to discover new arcane knowledge in this universe while guarding the secrecy of this knowledge.
7ba43156-5992-4f1f-9761-8c85572c1f6f:
Some gain power through study, some through devotion, others through blood, but the witch gains power from her communion with the unknown. Generally feared and misunderstood, the witch draws her magic from a pact made with an otherworldly power. Communing with that source, using her familiar as a conduit, the witch gains not only a host of spells, but a number of strange abilities known as hexes. As a witch grows in power, she might learn about the source of her magic, but some remain blissfully unaware. Some are even afraid of that source, fearful of what it might be or where its true purposes lie.
While many witches are recluses, living on the edge of civilization, some live within society, openly or in hiding. The blend of witches' spells makes them adept at filling a number of different roles, from seer to healer, and their hexes grant them a number of abilities that are useful in a fight. Some witches travel about, seeking greater knowledge and better understanding of the mysterious powers that guide them.
b1e6e09b-f5a2-43f4-8f23-c5d6d8db7d88: Some witches specialize in potions, using their magical abilities to enhance the properties of potions, and even making their allies stronger through use of arcane mixtures.
7b225c2b-cc6e-4dfd-85b6-57f8b60f4866: Some witches tap into the power of their patrons not through a special connection with a familiar, but rather directly through the vast network of ley lines that crosses the planes. These witches can harness the latent powers of ley lines without even needing to be near one of the points where ley lines' powers are accessible to mortal spellcasters.
b6d293be-c94f-474c-b3be-422fcce7de9e: Some witches think of their magic not as a gift, but as a curse. Her body is tarnished with a mark of her ill fate. Maybe the patron of such a witch was cruel and decided that power mustn't come cheap, or, maybe, they mercifully helped the witch to turn the adversities that befell her into a source of new strength. A stigmatized witch relies on intuition, her magic is based not on the sharpness of her wit, but on the strength of her character. Instead of the regular powers granted by a patron, such a witch gets a curse like an oracle, and she casts her spells spontaneously — like a sorcerer, rather than a wizard.
c0578936-1299-408a-a3dc-91ed3bb311de: Starting at 10th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a major hex whenever she could select a new hex.
e9d860d7-d1a2-4156-908a-f8741e1bce02: Starting at 18th level, and every two levels thereafter, a witch can choose a grand hex whenever she could select a new hex.
70e39072-af8c-45d2-8454-dcb6e0e12742: The creature gains one bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}.
bb66d329-40a3-45f1-913a-9d13503aa161: The creature gains two claw {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attacks{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d4{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} each.
ac7619b7-d237-4fbd-badb-8a6e6d07c002:
The target gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to half the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
9c5e72b5-4dd5-4181-9e00-00da6fb41d57: The target is rimed with a shell of frost needles that slowly work their way into its flesh ({g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude{/g} negates). The target turns pale and blue, and takes 1 point of {g|Encyclopedia:Constitution}Constitution{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}damage{/g} per minute until it dies, saves (once per minute), or is {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}cured{/g}. {g|SpellsBreakEnchantment}Break enchantment{/g}, {g|SpellsDispelMagic}dispel magic{/g}, {g|SpellsRemoveCurse}remove curse{/g}, and similar {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g} end the effect. If the target saves, it is immune to this hex for 1 day. This is a cold effect.
27bcfaf1-f33e-4106-aa4d-14184ad16e4c: The target of this hex becomes {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. As long as the witch remains within 30 feet of her target, she gains a +1 morale {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g} and a +1 morale bonus on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} as long as this effect persists. A successful Will save reduces the duration of this hex to 1 round. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.
763e2ab4-9384-4b98-a6fc-4240fc1a7b54:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A Will save reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
e756688f-a268-49ce-9407-a53f2ce9326e:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on one of the following (witch's choice): {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability checks{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill checks{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A Will save reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
5ddb7235-aea8-4145-a38f-e7b084a137ac:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack rolls{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
b4158cfa-c941-417b-ad85-173b7acd55da:
The target takes a –2 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 3 + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier (or 3 + {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier for Stigmatized Witch). A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round.
This is a mind-affecting effect. At 8th level the penalty increases to –4.
771b284a-8d49-445d-a2f0-50cb77caf153:
The target {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} up to 4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability score damage{/g} from two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
acc50343-5ccd-4a93-b693-ab1ead25bc4a: The witch can become an animal. This ability is similar to {g|SpellsBeastShapeII}beast shape II{/g}, polymorphing the witch into a leopard.
a79a78ff-53aa-4314-b774-8eb75c7c51fc: The witch can cause a creature within 30 feet to suffer grave misfortune for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Anytime the creature makes an {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}, it must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the worse result. A Will save negates this hex. At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. This hex affects all rolls the target must make while it lasts. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
9667ebb5-d443-41be-9240-71fc113ec64c:
The witch can cause fate to twist so that it benefits a creature within 30 feet for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. Whenever that creature is targeted by an effect that requires an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, including weapon attacks, the attacker must {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}roll{/g} twice and take the worse result.
At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. A witch cannot use this ability on herself. Hexes that affect the fortune hex, such as cackle, also affect protective luck.
90a0d900-d2a3-4942-be6c-fda5c76feac9:
The witch can cause the debilitating wounds of a creature she touches to quickly close, helping it heal rapidly.
The target gains {g|Encyclopedia:Fast_Healing}fast healing{/g} 5 for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to 1/2 the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Class_Level}class level{/g} or it {g|Encyclopedia:Healing}heals{/g} up to 4 points of {g|Encyclopedia:AbilityDamage}ability score damage{/g} from two {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability scores{/g}.
Once a creature has benefited from this hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
8314c84c-c61a-40f8-b1bc-8314e7fc74ee: The witch can grant a creature within 30 feet a bit of good luck for 1 {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g}. The target can call upon this good luck, allowing him to {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}reroll{/g} any {g|Encyclopedia:Ability_Scores}ability check{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack roll{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g}, or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skill check{/g}, taking the better result. At 8th level and 16th level, the duration of this hex is extended by 1 round. Once a creature has benefited from the fortune hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours.
899968e3-d997-449b-8eef-0105b5f41375: The witch can make her enemies {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Vulnerability}vulnerable{/g} to energy. This hex lasts for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level, during which any energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Resistance}resistance{/g} or energy {g|Encyclopedia:Energy_Immunity}immunities{/g} on the target are suppressed. A successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} reduces this to just 1 round. Whether or not the save is successful, that creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
92b3a087-3547-4617-85cd-b25f8c3596e0: The witch can touch a creature to suppress and protect it from negative conditions. The witch chooses one of the following conditions each time she uses this hex: dazzled, {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g}, {g|ConditionShaken}shaken{/g}, or {g|ConditionSickened}sickened{/g}. If the target is afflicted with the chosen condition, that condition is suppressed for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Additionally, the witch grants her target a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that cause the chosen conditions for 24 hours. A creature can benefit from the hex twice in 24 hours, once for each of two different conditions.
b6f45eb1-ab0b-454d-91f3-a0b3f5a1a810: The witch can touch a creature to suppress and protect it from negative conditions. The witch chooses one of the following conditions each time she uses this hex: {g|ConditionBlind}blinded{/g}, cursed, diseased, or poisoned. If the target is afflicted with the chosen condition, that condition is suppressed for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Additionally, the witch grants her target a +4 circumstance {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throws{/g} against effects that cause the chosen conditions for 24 hours. A creature can benefit from the hex twice in 24 hours, once for each of two different conditions.
43331a53-8184-4c17-9f58-3b393deb10d0: The witch can use her magic to grant her allies ferocious animal abilities. The witch can partially transform a willing ally, granting him {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural attacks{/g} for a number of minutes equal to the witch's level. Choose one: the creature gains one bite {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} that deals {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d8{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g}, or the creature gains two claw attacks that deal 1d4 points of damage each. These attacks follow the standard rules for natural attacks.
abba47b2-e349-4dd6-8b05-e4d736f4f050:
The witch can use this hex to turn a humanoid enemy into an animal and rob it of its free will.
The transformation works as {g|SpellsBeastShapeII}beast shape II{/g} and is negated by a successful {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g}. The transformed creature retains its {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} score and known languages, if any, but the witch controls its mind. This effect functions as {g|SpellsDominateMonster}dominate monster{/g}, except the creature does not receive further saving throws to resist the hex. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
2edc8195-69ab-470e-a1a5-391d6c637cb8:
The witch causes a creature within 30 feet to fall into a sleep riddled with nightmares. This functions as the slumber hex. Additionally, the restless nature of the sleep causes the creature to violently toss and turn, dealing {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d10{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} to itself each turn.
This damage does not wake the creature. When it wakes, the creature's addled state causes it to be {g|ConditionConfusion}confused{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to half the witch's level. The witch must have the slumber hex to select this hex.
0204ebfa-df04-410f-95bc-51f04743cab7: The witch may target a single undead creature with this hex as if with an {g|SpellsUndeathToDeath}undeath to death{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} negates this effect. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
1cc21fb5-a068-486e-9a15-6b92bd5b4610: The witch's nails are long and sharp, and count as {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapons{/g} that deal {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}1d3{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} (1d2 for a {g|Encyclopedia:Size}Small{/g} witch).
3ca787de-5560-4c26-8dbc-0e87dd5d565e: This acts as a {g|SpellsCureLightWounds}cure light wounds{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, using the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Once a creature has benefited from the healing hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours. At 5th level, this hex acts like {g|SpellsCureModerateWounds}cure moderate wounds{/g}.
ac359f30-44b5-4fd9-8253-1cb1280c6066: This hex acts as {g|SpellsCureSeriousWounds}cure serious wounds{/g}, using the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster level{/g}. Once a creature has benefited from the major healing hex, it cannot benefit from it again for 24 hours. At 15th level, this hex acts like {g|SpellsCureCriticalWounds}cure critical wounds{/g}.
cc40a4e0-7770-4bab-85a4-9ebc505757a8:
This hex grants the witch a +2 natural armor {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to {g|Encyclopedia:Armor_Class}AC{/g}.
The effect leaves the witch's skin thick and stiff to the touch.
fc2d28ad-244a-4cb0-bd18-18151a3f8c3a: This hex has a range of 30 feet. The hexed creature receives a {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Will save{/g} to negate the effect. If this save is failed, the creature becomes {g|ConditionFatigued}fatigued{/g} the first {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}round{/g} of the hex. On the second round of the hex, the creature becomes {g|ConditionExhausted}exhausted{/g}. On the third round, the creature dies unless it succeeds at a Fort save. Creatures that fail the first save but succeed at the second remain exhausted and take {g|Encyclopedia:Dice}4d6{/g} points of {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage{/g} + 1 point of damage per level of the witch. Slaying the witch that hexed the creature ends the effect, but any fatigue or exhaustion remains. Whether or not the saves are successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
dc69037a-15ec-4872-bf7d-2c5c2a33d324: This patron grants the witch a list of known {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spells{/g}:
4500568e-bd57-47cf-9247-d2e342de8827: Whether a changeling in the process of succumbing to her mother's call, a witch cursed by a hag to become her instrument of torment, a vain and petty witch overeager for power, or some other unfortunate soul, a hagbound witch finds its soul has been infected by a hag's spite and powerful, corrupt arcane magic. Her mind and body begin to transform to reflect her new being. Hagbound witches suffer a slow transformative taint that is similar to the accursed corruption and make ideal candidates for this additional power — and tragedy.
e2b7c955-bb2c-433d-ab4d-29c27022387a: Witch chooses a familiar who gives them a {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} to certain abilities or {g|Encyclopedia:Skills}skills{/g}.
df7e85cd-5be1-4240-a4d6-2f84219a9835: Witches are potent arcane spellcasters who can employ the strongest spells. They are especially good at controlling and weakening the enemies both with spells and unique magic abilities called hexes. Witches can also heal and empower their allies, though less effectively than some other classes. This is a difficult class to play for a newcomer.
5ff51f7b-97e4-4744-bbac-2fd6aedfe5c6:
Witches learn a number of magic tricks, called hexes, that grant them powers or weaken foes. At 1st level, a witch gains one hex of her choice. She gains an additional hex at 2nd level and for every 2 levels attained after 2nd level. A witch cannot select an individual hex more than once.
Using a hex is a {g|Encyclopedia:Standard_Actions}standard action{/g} that doesn't provoke an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack_Of_Opportunity}attack of opportunity{/g} unless otherwise noted. The {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}saving throw{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:DC}DC{/g} to resist a hex is equal to 10 + half the witch's level + the witch's {g|Encyclopedia:Intelligence}Intelligence{/g} modifier. For Stigmatized Witch the saving throw use {g|Encyclopedia:Charisma}Charisma{/g} modifier instead of Intelligence modifier.
25c895fd-2604-46bb-97b3-9ac88db8c3ce: Witches sometimes dive deep into elemental energies, allowing to evoke destructive powers upon their enemies.
764e2a5a-affa-41c8-a5b0-0f84761177a8: Witches who dedicate themselves to the Angry Hag are feared for their ability to bend minds and sow discord. Some say these witches can watch their enemies from afar and can even corrupt the minds of the most innocent or loyal, including newborn babes and cherished pets.
977690e2-6395-4e15-a680-59b19c7303dd: With a quick incantation, a witch can place this hex on one creature within 60 feet, causing them to suffer intense pain. The target is {g|ConditionNauseated}nauseated{/g} for a number of {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Round}rounds{/g} equal to the witch's level. A {g|Encyclopedia:Saving_Throw}Fortitude save{/g} negates this effect. If the saving throw is failed, the target can attempt a new save each round to end the effect. Whether or not the save is successful, a creature cannot be the target of this hex again for 1 day.
45846e0d-6304-45fe-bddb-1fbce1fb98ce:
Your next mind-affecting {g|Encyclopedia:Spell}spell{/g}, {g|Encyclopedia:Special_Abilities}spell-like ability{/g}, or hex also affects all its targets with a {g|SpellsGreaterDispelMagicTarget}targeted greater dispel magic{/g} effect.
This functions as a {g|SpellsDispelMagicTarget}targeted dispel magic{/g}, but it can dispel one spell for every four {g|Encyclopedia:Caster_Level}caster levels{/g} you possess, starting with the highest level spells and proceeding to lower level spells.
